title: placed in queue
body:
Hi,

i have just been given 5 games of long queue time, (20 mins per game )
i had a disconnection with my internet.
i re booted the modem and then went to reconnect to the game and it had logged me out.
i would never leave a game intentionally, if you could remove this it would be muchly appreciated.

regards.

replies.body:
Hey there,

Leaverbuster punishments can not and will not be removed under any circumstance, while riot understands that sometimes rl issues can come up that take priority over the game it is your responsibility to make sure you're able to dedicate enough time to play a full game and that your game/network is working correctly before play.

Leaverbuster also does not punish for leaving a single game, it takes multiple leaves/afk's for the system to punish you.

To read more about the leaverbuster system check out the FAQ [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ).

so its now my fault that my internet crashed?

ridiculous.

each time before that i have never left a game intentionally. always my providers fault.

pretty average on your teams behalf if i am at fault here.

Hey there,

If you're experiencing constant outages with your Internet service you should contact your provider and work with them to resolve those issues.

As stated in my previous post, it is your responsibility to ensure you're able to commit enough time to a game and that both your game client and connection are stable.

>**IT'S NOT MY FAULT. MY INTERNET/YOUR SERVERS DISCONNECTED ME. I HAD A REAL-LIFE EMERGENCY. I HAD TO GET OFF THE COMPUTER. THE GAME CRASHED. UNBAN ME!**


>We understand that players may be forced to leave from time to time so the system has been designed to keep these situations in mind. After leaving a few games, you will be placed into a low priority queue; as long as you can complete 5 matchmade games without leaving, you will be returned to the normal queue. However, if you continue to leave games, you will remain in the low priority queue.
